<mask> ( (listen) oh-MAHN; Arabic: عمان‎ ʻumān [ʕʊˈmaːn]), officially the Sultanate of <mask> (Arabic: سلطنة عُمان‎ Salṭanat ʻUmān), is an Arab country on the southeastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula in Western Asia. Its official religion is Islam.Holding a strategically important position at the mouth of the Persian Gulf, the country shares land borders with the <mask> to the northwest, <mask> to the west, and <mask> to the southwest, and shares marine borders with <mask> and <mask>. The coast is formed by the Arabian Sea on the southeast and the Gulf of <mask> on the northeast. The Madha and Musandam exclaves are surrounded by the UAE on their land borders, with the Strait of Hormuz (which it shares with <mask>) and Gulf of <mask> forming Musandam's coastal boundaries.From the late 17th century, the <mask>i Sultanate was a powerful empire, vying with <mask> and the UK for influence in the Persian Gulf and <mask>n Ocean. At its peak in the 19th century, <mask>i influence or control extended across the Strait of Hormuz to modern-day <mask> and <mask>, and as far south as Zanzibar. When its power declined in the 20th century, the sultanate came under the influence of the <mask>. For over 300 years, the relations built between the two empires were based on mutual benefits. The UK recognized <mask>'s geographical importance as a trading hub that secured their trade lanes in the Persian Gulf and <mask>n Ocean and protected their empire in the <mask>n sub-continent. Historically, Muscat was the principal trading port of the Persian Gulf region. Muscat was also among the most important trading ports of the <mask>n Ocean.The Sultan Qaboos bin Said al Said has been the hereditary leader of the country, an absolute monarchy, since 1970. Sultan Qaboos is the longest-serving current ruler in the Middle East, and third-longest current reigning monarch in the world.<mask> is a member of the United Nations, the Arab League, the Gulf Cooperation Council, the Non-Aligned Movement and the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation. It has sizable oil reserves, ranking 25th globally. In 2010, the United Nations Development Programme ranked <mask> as the most improved nation in the world in terms of development during the preceding 40 years. A significant portion of its economy involves tourism and trade of fish, dates, and certain agricultural produce. <mask> is categorized as a high-income economy and ranks as the 70th most peaceful country in the world according to the Global Peace Index.

<mask>, officially the Territory of the <mask> Islands (/ˈwɒlɪs ... fuːˈtuːnə/), is a French island collectivity in the South Pacific, situated between <mask> to the northwest, <mask> to the southwest, <mask> to the southeast, <mask> to the east, and <mask> to the northeast.

<mask> (; Portuguese: [sɐ̃w̃ tuˈmɛ i ˈpɾĩsɨpɨ]), officially the Democratic Republic of <mask>, is an island country in the Gulf of <mask>, off the western equatorial coast of Central Africa. It consists of two archipelagos around the two main islands of <mask>, about 140 km (87 mi) apart and about 250 and 225 km (155 and 140 mi) off the northwestern coast of <mask>, respectively.The islands were uninhabited until their discovery  by Portuguese explorers in the 15th century. Gradually colonised and settled by the Portuguese throughout the 16th century, they collectively served as a vital commercial and trade center for the Atlantic slave trade. The rich volcanic soil and close proximity to the Equator made <mask> ideal for sugar cultivation, followed later by cash crops such as coffee and cocoa; the lucrative plantation economy was heavily dependent upon imported African slaves. Cycles of social unrest and economic instability throughout the 19th and 20th centuries culminated in peaceful independence in 1975. <mask> has since remained one of Africa's most stable and democratic countries.With a population of 201,800 (2018 official estimate), <mask> is the second-smallest African sovereign state after <mask>, as well as the smallest Portuguese-speaking country. Its people are predominantly of African and mestiço descent, with most practising R<mask> Catholicism. The legacy of Portuguese rule is also visible in the country's culture, customs, and music, which fuse European and African influences. <mask> is a founding member state of the Community of Portuguese Language Countries.

Papua New <mask> (PNG; UK: , US: ; Tok Pisin: Papua Niugini; Hiri Motu: Papua Niu Gini), officially the Independent State of Papua New <mask> (Tok Pisin: Independen Stet bilong Papua Niugini; Hiri Motu: Independen Stet bilong Papua Niu Gini) is a country in Oceania that occupies the eastern half of the island of New <mask> and its offshore islands in Melanesia, a region of the southwestern Pacific Ocean north of <mask>. Its capital, located along its southeastern coast, is Port Moresby. The western half of New <mask> forms the <mask>n provinces of Papua and West Papua.At the national level, after being ruled by three external powers since 1884, Papua New <mask> established its sovereignty in 1975. This followed nearly 60 years of <mask>n administration, which started during World War I. It became an independent Commonwealth realm in 1975 with Elizabeth II as its queen. It also became a member of the Commonwealth of Nations in its own right.Papua New <mask> is one of the most culturally diverse countries in the world. It is also one of the most rural, as only 18 per cent of its people live in urban centres. There are 851 known languages in the country, of which 11 now have no known living speakers. Most of the population of more than 8 million people lives in customary communities, which are as diverse as the languages. The country is one of the world's least explored, culturally and geographically. It is known to have numerous groups of uncontacted peoples, and researchers believe there are many undiscovered species of plants and animals in the interior.Papua New <mask> is classified as a developing economy by the International Monetary Fund. Strong growth in Papua New <mask>'s mining and resource sector led to the country becoming the sixth-fastest-growing economy in the world in 2011. Growth was expected to slow once major resource projects came on line in 2015. Mining remains a major economic factor, however. Local and national governments are discussing the potential of resuming mining operations at the Panguna mine in Bougainville Province, which has been closed since the civil war in the 1980s–1990s. Nearly 40 per cent of the population lives a self-sustainable natural lifestyle with no access to global capital.Most of the people still live in strong traditional social groups based on farming. Their social lives combine traditional religion with modern practices, including primary education. These societies and clans are explicitly acknowledged by the Papua New <mask> Constitution, which expresses the wish for "traditional villages and communities to remain as viable units of Papua New <mask>n society" and protects their continuing importance to local and national community life. The nation is an observer state in the Association of Southeast Asian Nations or ASEAN since 1976, and has already filed its application for full membership status. It is a full member of the Pacific Islands Forum (formerly South Pacific Forum) and the Commonwealth of Nations.

The Sahrawi Republic (), officially the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic (SADR; also r<mask>ized with Saharawi; Spanish: República Árabe Saharaui Democrática; Arabic: الجمهورية العربية الصحراوية الديمقراطية‎ al-Jumhūrīyah al-'Arabīyah aṣ-Ṣaḥrāwīyah ad-Dīmuqrāṭīyah), is a partially recognized state that claims the non-self-governing territory of <mask>, but controls only the easternmost one-fifth of that territory. Until 1976, <mask> was known as Spanish Sahara, a Spanish colony (later an overseas province).SADR was proclaimed by the Polisario Front (a former socialist liberation force which has since reformed its ideological and political views) on February 27, 1976, in Bir Lehlou, <mask>. The SADR government controls about 20–25% of the territory it claims. It calls the territories under its control the Liberated Territories or the Free Zone. <mask> controls and administers the rest of the disputed territory, and calls these lands its Southern Provinces. The SADR government considers the Moroccan-held territory to be occupied territory, while <mask> considers the much smaller SADR-held territory to be a buffer zone. The claimed capital of the SADR is former <mask> capital El-Aaiún, while the temporary capital moved from Bir Lehlou to Tifariti in 2008.The Sahrawi Republic maintains diplomatic relations with 40 UN states, and is a full member of the African Union.

<mask> ( (listen); Spanish: [uɾuˈɣu̯ai] (listen)), officially the Oriental Republic of <mask> (Spanish: República Oriental del <mask>), is a country  in the southeastern region of South America. It borders <mask> to its west and <mask> to its north and east, with the Río de la Plata (River of Silver) to the south and the Atlantic Ocean to the southeast. <mask> is home to an estimated 3.44 million people, of whom 1.8 million live in the metropolitan area of its capital and largest city, Montevideo. With an area of approximately 176,000 square kilometers (68,000 sq mi), <mask> is geographically the second-smallest nation in South America, after <mask>.<mask> was inhabited by the Charrúa people for approximately 4,000 years before the Portuguese established Colonia del Sacramento in 1680; <mask> was colonized by Europeans relatively late compared with neighboring countries. Montevideo was founded as a military stronghold by the Spanish in the early 18th century, signifying the competing claims over the region. <mask> won its independence between 1811 and 1828, following a four-way struggle between <mask>, <mask>, and later <mask> and <mask>. It remained subject to foreign influence and intervention throughout the 19th century, with the military playing a recurring role in domestic politics.A series of economic crises put an end to a democratic period that had begun in the early 20th century, culminating in a 1973 coup, which established a civic-military dictatorship. The military government persecuted leftists, socialists, and political opponents, resulting in several deaths and numerous instances of torture by the military; the military relinquished power to a civilian government in 1985. <mask> is today a democratic constitutional republic, with a president who serves as both head of state and head of government.<mask> is ranked first in Latin America in democracy, peace, low perception of corruption, e-government, and is first in South America when it comes to press freedom, size of the middle class and prosperity. On a per-capita basis, <mask> contributes more troops to United Nations peacekeeping missions than any other country. It tops the rank of absence of terrorism, a unique position within South America. It ranks second in the region on economic freedom, income equality, per-capita income and inflows of FDI. <mask> is the third-best country on the continent in terms of HDI, GDP growth, innovation and infrastructure. It is regarded as a high-income country by the UN. <mask> was also ranked the third-best in the world in e-Participation in 2014.<mask> is an important global exporter of combed wool, rice, soybeans, frozen beef, malt and milk. Nearly 95% of <mask>'s electricity comes from renewable energy, mostly hydroelectric facilities and wind parks. <mask> is a founding member of the United Nations, OAS, Mercosur, UNASUR and NAM.<mask> is regarded as one of the most socially advanced countries in Latin America. It ranks high on global measures of personal rights, tolerance, and inclusion issues. The Economist named <mask> "country of the year" in 2013, acknowledging the policy of legalizing the production, sale and consumption of cannabis.

<mask> ( (listen); Arabic: ليبيا‎, r<mask>ized: Lībiyā; Italian: Libia), officially the State of <mask>, is a country in the Maghreb region in North Africa, bordered by the Mediterranean Sea to the north, <mask> to the east, <mask> to the southeast, <mask> to the south, <mask> to the southwest, <mask> to the west, and <mask> to the northwest. The sovereign state  is made of three historical regions: Tripolitania, Fezzan and Cyrenaica. With an area of almost 1.8 million square kilometres (700,000 sq mi), <mask> is the fourth largest country in Africa, and is the 16th largest country in the world. <mask> has the 10th-largest proven oil reserves of any country in the world. The largest city and capital, Tripoli, is located in western <mask> and contains over one million of <mask>'s six million people. The second-largest city is Benghazi, which is located in eastern <mask>.<mask> has been inhabited by Berbers since the late Bronze Age. The Phoenicians established trading posts in western <mask>, and ancient Greek colonists established city-states in eastern <mask>. <mask> was variously ruled by Carthaginians, Persians, <mask>ians and Greeks before becoming a part of the R<mask> Empire. <mask> was an early centre of Christianity. After the fall of the Western R<mask> Empire, the area of <mask> was mostly occupied by the Vandals until the 7th century, when invasions brought Islam to the region. In the 16th century, the Spanish Empire and the Knights of St John occupied Tripoli, until Ott<mask> rule began in 1551. <mask> was involved in the Barbary Wars of the 18th and 19th centuries. Ott<mask> rule continued until the Italian occupation of <mask> resulted in the temporary Italian <mask> colony from 1911 to 1947. During the Second World War, <mask> was an important area of warfare in the North African Campaign. The Italian population then went into decline.<mask> became independent as a kingdom in 1951. A military coup in 1969 overthrew King Idris I. The "bloodless" coup leader Muammar Gaddafi ruled the country from 1969 and the <mask>n Cultural Revolution in 1973 until he was overthrown and killed in the 2011 <mask>n Civil War. Two authorities initially claimed to govern <mask>: the Council of Deputies in Tobruk and the 2014 General National Congress (GNC) in Tripoli, which considered itself the continuation of the General National Congress, elected in 2012. After UN-led peace talks between the Tobruk and Tripoli governments, a unified interim UN-backed Government of National Accord was established in 2015, and the GNC disbanded to support it. Parts of <mask> remain outside either government's control, with various Islamist, rebel and tribal militias administering some areas. As of July 2017, talks are still ongoing between the GNA and the Tobruk-based authorities to end the strife and unify the divided establishments of the state, including the <mask>n National Army and the Central Bank of <mask>.<mask> is a member of the United Nations (since 1955), the Non-Aligned Movement, the Arab League, the OIC and OPEC. The country's official religion is Islam, with 96.6% of the <mask>n population being Sunni Muslims.

<mask> (Korean: 조선; MR: Chosŏn or literally 북조선; MR: Pukchosŏn), officially the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK or DPR Korea; Korean: 조선민주주의인민공화국, Chosŏn Minjujuŭi Inmin Konghwaguk), is a country in East Asia constituting the northern part of the Korean Peninsula, with Pyongyang the capital and the largest city in the country. To the north and northwest, the country is bordered by <mask> and by <mask> along the Amnok (known as the Yalu in Chinese) and Tumen rivers and to the south it is bordered by <mask>, with the heavily fortified Korean Demilitarized Zone (DMZ) separating the two. Nevertheless, <mask>, like its southern counterpart, claims to be the legitimate government of the entire peninsula and adjacent islands.In 1910, Korea was annexed by Imperial <mask>. After the <mask>ese surrender at the end of World War II in 1945, Korea was divided into two zones, with the north occupied by the Soviet Union and the south occupied by the <mask>. Negotiations on reunification failed, and in 1948, separate governments were formed: the socialist Democratic People's Republic of Korea in the north, and the capitalist Republic of Korea in the south. An invasion initiated by <mask> led to the Korean War (1950–1953). The Korean Armistice Agreement brought about a ceasefire, but no peace treaty was signed.<mask> officially describes itself as a "self-reliant" socialist state, and formally holds elections, though said elections have been described by outside observers as sham elections. Outside observers also generally view <mask> as a Stalinist totalitarian dictatorship, particularly noting the elaborate cult of personality around Kim Il-sung and his family. The Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), led by a member of the ruling family, holds power in the state and leads the Democratic Front for the Reunification of the Fatherland of which all political officers are required to be members. Juche, an ideology of national self-reliance, was introduced into the constitution in 1972. The means of production are owned by the state through state-run enterprises and collectivized farms. Most services such as healthcare, education, housing and food production are subsidized or state-funded. From 1994 to 1998, <mask> suffered a famine that resulted in the deaths of between 240,000 and 420,000 people, and the population continues to suffer malnutrition. <mask> follows Songun, or "military-first" policy. It is the country with the highest number of military and paramilitary personnel, with a total of 9,495,000 active, reserve and paramilitary personnel, or approximately 37% of its population.  Its active duty army of 1.21 million is the fourth largest in the world, after <mask>, the <mask> and <mask>; consisting of 4.8% of its population.  It possesses nuclear weapons.A 2014 UN inquiry into human rights in <mask> concluded that, "The gravity, scale and nature of these violations reveal a state that does not have any parallel in the contemporary world". The <mask>n regime strongly denies most allegations, accusing international organizations of fabricating human rights abuses as part of a smear campaign with the covert intention of undermining the state, although they admit that there are human rights issues relating to living conditions which the regime is attempting to correct.In addition to being a member of the United Nations since 1991, the sovereign state is also a member of the Non-Aligned Movement, G77 and the ASEAN Regional Forum.

Åland (/ˈɔːlənd/[9] AW-lənd, Swedish: [ˈǒːland]; Finnish: Ahvenanmaa) is an autonomous and demilitarised region of <mask>. Receiving its autonomy by a 1920 decision of the League of Nations, it is the smallest region of <mask> by both area (1,580 km2 or 610 sq mi) and population (30,541), constituting 0.51% of <mask>'s land area and 0.54% of its population. Its only official language is Swedish and the capital city is Mariehamn.

<mask> ( TOO-və-loo), formerly known as the Ellice Islands, is a Polynesian island country located in the Pacific Ocean, situated in Oceania, about midway between Hawaii and <mask>. It lies east-northeast of the Santa Cruz Islands (which belong to the <mask>), southeast of <mask>, south of <mask>, west of <mask>, northwest of <mask> and <mask>, and north of <mask>. It comprises three reef islands and six true atolls spread out between the latitude of 5° to 10° south and longitude of 176° to 180°, west of the International Date Line. <mask> has a population of 10,640 (2012 census). The total land area of the islands of <mask> is 26 square kilometres (10 sq mi).The first inhabitants of <mask> were Polynesians. The origins of the people of <mask> are addressed in the theories regarding migration into the Pacific that began about three thousand years ago. During pre-European-contact times there was frequent canoe voyaging between the islands as Polynesian navigation skills are recognised to have allowed deliberate journeys on double-hull sailing canoes or outrigger canoes. The pattern of settlement that is believed to have occurred is that the Polynesians spread out from <mask> and <mask> into the <mask>an atolls, with <mask> providing a stepping stone to further migration into the Polynesian outliers in Melanesia and <mask>.In 1568, Spanish navigator Álvaro de Mendaña was the first European to sail through the archipelago, sighting the island of Nui during his expedition in search of Terra Australis. The island of Funafuti was named Ellice's Island in 1819; the name Ellice was applied to all of the nine islands after the work of English hydrographer Alexander George Findlay. The Ellice Islands came into Great Britain's sphere of influence in the late 19th century, as the result of a treaty between Great Britain and <mask> relating to the demarcation of the spheres of influence in the Pacific Ocean. Each of the Ellice Islands was declared a British Protectorate by Captain Gibson of HMS Curacoa between 9 and 16 October 1892. The Ellice Islands were administered as a British protectorate by a Resident Commissioner from 1892 to 1916, as part of the British Western Pacific Territories (BWPT), and then as part of the Gilbert and Ellice Islands colony from 1916 to 1976.A referendum was held in December 1974 to determine whether the Gilbert Islands and Ellice Islands should each have their own administration. As a consequence of the referendum, the Gilbert and Ellice Islands colony ceased to exist on 1 January 1976, and the separate British colonies of <mask> and <mask> came into existence. <mask> became fully independent within the Commonwealth on 1 October 1978. On 5 September 2000, <mask> became the 189th member of the United Nations.

<mask> ( (listen), ; Tajik: Тоҷикистон [tɔdʒikisˈtɔn]), officially the Republic of <mask> (Tajik: Ҷумҳурии Тоҷикистон, Jumhuriyi Tojikiston), is a mountainous, landlocked country in Central Asia with an area of 143,100 km2 (55,300 sq mi) and an estimated population of 9,275,828 people. It is bordered by <mask> to the south, <mask> to the west, <mask> to the north, and <mask> to the east. The traditional homelands of the Tajik people include present-day <mask> as well as parts of <mask> and <mask>.The territory that now constitutes <mask> was previously home to several ancient cultures, including the city of Sarazm of the Neolithic and the Bronze Age, and was later home to kingdoms ruled by people of different faiths and cultures, including the Oxus civilisation, Andronovo culture, Buddhism, Nestorian Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Manichaeism and Islam. The area has been ruled by numerous empires and dynasties, including the Achaemenid Empire, Sasanian Empire, Hephthalite Empire, Samanid Empire, Mongol Empire, Timurid dynasty, the Khanate of Bukhara, the <mask>n Empire, and subsequently the Soviet Union. Within the Soviet Union, the country's modern borders were drawn when it was part of <mask> as an autonomous republic before becoming a full-fledged Soviet republic in 1929.On 9 September 1991, <mask> became an independent sovereign nation when the Soviet Union disintegrated. A civil war was fought almost immediately after independence, lasting from 1992 to 1997. Since the end of the war, newly established political stability and foreign aid have allowed the country's economy to grow. Like all other Central Asian neighbouring states, the country, led by President Emo<mask> Rahmon since 1994, has been criticised by a number of non-governmental organizations for authoritarian leadership, lack of religious freedom, corruption and widespread violations of human rights.<mask> is a presidential republic consisting of four provinces. Most of <mask>'s population belongs to the Tajik ethnic group, who speak Tajik (a dialect of Persian). <mask>n is used as inter-ethniclanguage. While the state is constitutionally secular, Islam is practiced by 98% of the population. In the Gorno-Badakhshan Oblast of <mask>, despite its sparse population, there is large linguistic diversity where Rushani, Shughni, Ishkashimi, Wakhi and Tajik are some of the languages spoken. Mountains cover more than 90% of the country. It has a transition economy that is highly dependent on remittances, aluminium and cotton production. <mask> is a member of the United Nations, CIS, OSCE, OIC, ECO, SCO and CSTO as well as an NATO PfP partner.

<mask> (; Amharic: ኢትዮጵያ, ʾĪtyōṗṗyā, listen , Tigrinya: ኢትዮጵያ, Oromo: Itoophiyaa, So<mask>: Itoobiya), officially the Federal Democratic Republic of <mask> (የኢትዮጵያ ፌዴራላዊ ዲሞክራሲያዊ ሪፐብሊክ, yeʾĪtiyoṗṗya Fēdēralawī Dēmokirasīyawī Rīpebilīk, listen ), is a country in the northeastern part of Africa, known as the Horn of Africa. It shares borders with <mask> to the north, <mask> to the northeast, So<mask>land and <mask> to the east, <mask> to the south, <mask> to the west and <mask> to the northwest. With over 102 million inhabitants, <mask> is the most populous landlocked country in the world and the second-most populous nation on the African continent with a total area of 1,100,000 square kilometres (420,000 sq mi). Its capital and largest city is Addis Ababa, which lies a few miles west of the East African Rift that splits the country into the Nubian and So<mask> tectonic plates.Some of the oldest skeletal evidence for anatomically modern humans has been found in <mask>. It is widely considered as the region from which modern humans first set out for the Middle East and places beyond. According to linguists, the first Afroasiatic-speaking populations settled in the Horn region during the ensuing Neolithic era. Tracing its roots to the 2nd millennium BCE, <mask>'s governmental system was a monarchy for most of its history. Oral literature tells that the monarchy was founded by the Solomonic dynasty of the Queen of Sheba, under its first king, Menelik I. In the first centuries , the Kingdom of Aksum maintained a unified civilization in the region, followed by the <mask>n Empire circa 1137. During the late 19th-century Scramble for Africa, <mask> and <mask> were two nations that preserved their sovereignty from long-term colonisation by a European colonial power and many newly-independent nations on the continent subsequently adopted its flag colours. The country was occupied by <mask> in 1936 and became Italian <mask> (part of Italian East Africa) until it was liberated during World War II. <mask> was also the first independent member from Africa of the 20th-century League of Nations and the United Nations. In 1974, the <mask>n monarchy under Haile Selassie was overthrown by the Derg, a communist military government backed by the Soviet Union. In 1987, the Derg established the People's Democratic Republic of <mask>, but it was overthrown in 1991 by the <mask>n People's Revolutionary Democratic Front, which has been the ruling political coalition since.<mask> and <mask> use the ancient Ge'ez script, which is one of the oldest alphabets still in use in the world. The <mask>n calendar, which is approximately seven years and three months behind the Gregorian calendar, co-exists alongside the Borana calendar. A majority of the population adheres to Christianity (mainly the <mask>n Orthodox Tewahedo Church and P'ent'ay) and the historical Kingdom of Aksum was one of the first states to officially adopt the religion, whereas around a third follows Islam (primarily Sunni). The country is the site of the Migration to Abyssinia and the oldest Muslim settlement in Africa at Negash. A substantial population of <mask>n Jews, known as Bete <mask>, also resided in <mask> until the 1980s. <mask> is a multilingual nation with around 80 ethnolinguistic groups, the four largest of which are the Oromo, Amhara, So<mask> and Tigrayans. Most people in the country speak Afroasiatic languages of the Cushitic or Semitic branches. Additionally, Omotic languages are spoken by ethnic minority groups inhabiting the southern regions. Nilo-Saharan languages are also spoken by the nation's Nilotic ethnic minorities. Oromo is the most populous language by native speakers, while Amharic is the most populous by number of total speakers and serves as the working language in the federal government. Ge'ez remains important as a liturgical language, both for the <mask>n Orthodox Tewahedo Church, <mask>n Orthodox Tewahedo Church, and for the Beta <mask> (<mask>n Jews).The nation is a land of natural contrasts, with its vast fertile west, its forests, and numerous rivers, and the world's hottest settlement of Dallol in its north. The <mask>n Highlands are the largest continuous mountain ranges in Africa, and the Sof Omar Caves contains the largest cave on the continent. <mask> also has the most UNESCO World Heritage Sites in Africa. Additionally, the sovereign state is a founding member of the UN, the Group of 24 (G-24), the Non-Aligned Movement, G-77 and the Organisation of African Unity. Its capital city Addis Ababa serves as the headquarters of the African Union, the Pan African Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa, the African Standby Force, and many of the global NGOs focused on Africa. In the 1970s and 1980s, <mask> experienced civil conflicts and communist purges, which hindered its economy. The country has since recovered and now has the largest economy (by GDP) in East Africa, having the largest population in the region.

<mask> ( (listen) broo-NY), officially the Nation of <mask>, the Abode of Peace (Malay: Negara <mask> Darussalam, Jawi: نڬارا بروني دارالسلام‎), is a country located on the north coast of the island of Borneo in Southeast Asia. Apart from its coastline with the South <mask> Sea, the country is completely surrounded by the <mask>n state of Sarawak. It is separated into two parts by the Sarawak district of Limbang. <mask> is the only sovereign state completely on the island of Borneo; the remainder of the island's territory is divided between the nations of <mask> and <mask>. <mask>'s population was 423,196 in 2016.At the peak of the <mask>an Empire, Sultan Bolkiah (reigned 1485–1528) is alleged to have had control over most regions of Borneo, including modern-day Sarawak and Sabah, as well as the Sulu Archipelago off the northeast tip of Borneo, Seludong (modern-day Manila), and the islands off the northwest tip of Borneo. The Sultanate ceded Sarawak (Kuching) to James Brooke and installed him as the White Rajah, and it ceded Sabah to the British North Borneo Chartered Company. In 1962, a small armed rebellion against the monarchy was ended with the help of the British.<mask> gained its independence from the <mask> on 1 January 1984. Economic growth during the 1990s and 2000s, with the GDP increasing 56% from 1999 to 2008, transformed <mask> into an industrialised country. It has developed wealth from extensive petroleum and natural gas fields. <mask> has the second-highest Human Development Index among the Southeast Asian nations, after <mask>, and is classified as a "developed country". According to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), <mask> is ranked fifth in the world by gross domestic product per capita at purchasing power parity. The IMF estimated in 2011 that <mask> was one of two countries (the other being <mask>) with a public debt at 0% of the national GDP. Forbes also ranks <mask> as the fifth-richest nation out of 182, based on its petroleum and natural gas fields.

<mask>, officially the Commonwealth of <mask>, is a sovereign country comprising the mainland of the <mask>n continent, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands. It is the largest country in Oceania and the world's sixth-largest country by total area. The neighbouring countries are Papua New <mask>, <mask>, and East Timor to the north; the <mask> and <mask> to the north-east; and <mask> to the south-east. The population of 25 million is highly urbanised and heavily concentrated on the eastern seaboard. <mask>'s capital is Canberra, and its largest city is Sydney. The country's other major metropolitan areas are Melbourne, Brisbane, Perth, and Adelaide.Indigenous <mask>ns inhabited the continent for about 65,000 years prior to European discovery with the arrival of Dutch explorers in the early 17th century, who named it New Holland. In 1770, <mask>'s eastern half was claimed by Great Britain and initially settled through penal transportation to the colony of New South Wales from 26 January 1788, a date which became <mask>'s national day. The population grew steadily in subsequent decades, and by the time of an 1850s gold rush, most of the continent had been explored and an additional five self-governing crown colonies established. On 1 January 1901, the six colonies federated, forming the Commonwealth of <mask>. <mask> has since maintained a stable liberal democratic political system that functions as a federal parliamentary constitutional monarchy, comprising six states and ten territories.Being the oldest, flattest and driest inhabited continent, with the least fertile soils, <mask> has a landmass of 7,617,930 square kilometres (2,941,300 sq mi). A megadiverse country, its size gives it a wide variety of landscapes, with deserts in the centre, tropical rainforests in the north-east and mountain ranges in the south-east. Its population density, 2.8 inhabitants per square kilometre, remains among the lowest in the world. <mask> generates its income from various sources including mining-related exports, telecommunications, banking, and manufacturing.<mask> is a highly developed country, with the world's 14th-largest economy. It has a high-income economy, with the world's tenth-highest per capita income. It is a regional power and has the world's 13th-highest military expenditure. <mask> has the world's eighth-largest immigrant population, with immigrants accounting for 29% of the population. Having the third-highest human development index and the eighth-highest ranked democracy globally, the country ranks highly in quality of life, health, education, economic freedom, civil liberties and political rights, with all its major cities faring well in global comparative livability surveys. <mask> is a member of the United Nations, G20, Commonwealth of Nations, ANZUS, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), World Trade Organization, Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation, Pacific Islands Forum, and the ASEAN Plus Six mechanism.

<mask> (<mask>ic: Kalaallit Nunaat, pronounced [kalaːɬit nunaːt]; Danish: Grønland, pronounced [ˈkʁɶnˌlænˀ]) is an autonomous country of the Kingdom of <mask>, located between the Arctic and Atlantic oceans, east of the Canadian Arctic Archipelago. Though physiographically a part of the continent of North America, <mask> has been politically and culturally associated with Europe (specifically <mask> and <mask>, the colonial powers, as well as the nearby island of <mask>) for more than a millennium. The majority of its residents are Inuit, whose ancestors began migrating from the Canadian mainland in the 13th century, gradually settling across the island.<mask> is the world's largest island (<mask> and Antarctica, both larger than <mask>, are generally considered to be continental landmasses rather than islands).  Three-quarters of <mask> is covered by the only permanent ice sheet outside Antarctica. With a population of about 56,480 (2013), it is the least densely populated territory in the world. About a third of the population live in Nuuk, the capital and largest city. The Arctic Umiaq Line ferry acts as a lifeline for western <mask>, connecting the various cities and settlements.<mask> has been inhabited at intervals over at least the last 4,500 years by Arctic peoples whose forebears migrated there from what is now <mask>. Norsemen settled the uninhabited southern part of <mask> beginning in the 10th century, having previously settled <mask> to escape persecution from the King of <mask> and his central government. These Norsemen would later set sail from <mask> and <mask>, with Leif Erikson becoming the first known European to reach North America nearly 500 years before Columbus reached the Caribbean islands. Inuit peoples arrived in the 13th century. Though under continuous influence of <mask> and Norwegians, <mask> was not formally under the Norwegian crown until 1262. The Norse colonies disappeared in the late 15th century when <mask> was hit by the Black Death and entered a severe decline. Soon after their demise, beginning in 1499, the Portuguese briefly explored and claimed the island, naming it Terra do Lavrador (later applied to Labrador in <mask>).In the early 18th century, Danish explorers reached <mask> again. To strengthen trading and power, <mask>–<mask> affirmed sovereignty over the island. Because of <mask>'s weak status, it lost sovereignty over <mask> in 1814 when the union was dissolved. <mask> became Danish in 1814, and was fully integrated in the Danish state in 1953 under the Constitution of <mask>.In 1973, <mask> joined the European Economic Community with <mask>. However, in a referendum in 1982, a majority of the population voted for <mask> to withdraw from the EEC, which was effected in 1985. <mask> contains the world's largest and most northerly national park, Northeast <mask> National Park (Kalaallit Nunaanni nuna eqqissisimatitaq). Established in 1974, and expanded to its present size in 1988, it protects 972,001 square kilometres (375,292 sq mi) of the interior and northeastern coast of <mask> and is bigger than all but twenty-nine countries in the world. <mask> is divided into five municipalities – Sermersooq, Kujalleq, Qeqertalik, Qeqqata, and Avannaata. <mask> does not have an independent seat at the United Nations.In 1979, <mask> granted home rule to <mask>, and in 2008, <mask>ers voted in favor of the Self-Government Act, which transferred more power from the Danish government to the local <mask>ic government. Under the new structure, in effect since 21 June 2009, <mask> can gradually assume responsibility for policing, judicial system, company law, accounting, and auditing; mineral resource activities; aviation; law of legal capacity, family law and succession law; aliens and border controls; the working environment; and financial regulation and supervision, while the Danish government retains control of foreign affairs and defence. It also retains control of monetary policy, providing an initial annual subsidy of DKK 3.4 billion, which is planned to diminish gradually over time. <mask> expects to grow its economy based on increased income from the extraction of natural resources. The capital, Nuuk, held the 2016 Arctic Winter Games. At 70%, <mask> has one of the highest shares of renewable energy in the world, mostly coming from hydropower.

<mask> ( (listen); Chinese: 香港, <mask> Cantonese: [hœ́ːŋ.kɔ̌ːŋ] (listen)), officially the <mask> Special Administrative Region of the People's Republic of <mask>, is a special administrative region on the eastern side of the Pearl River estuary in southern <mask>. With over 7.4 million people of various nationalities in a 1,104-square-kilometre (426 sq mi) territory, <mask> is one of the most densely populated places in the world.<mask> became a colony of the British Empire at the end of the First Opium War in 1842. Its people tend to identify as Hongkongers rather than Chinese.Originally a sparsely populated area of farming and fishing villages, the territory has become one of the world's most significant financial centres and commercial ports. It was estimated to be the world's tenth-largest exporter, ninth-largest importer, and seventh-largest trading entity, and its legal tender (the <mask> dollar) is the world's 13th-most traded currency. <mask> hosts the largest concentration of ultra high-net-worth individuals of any city in the world. Although the city has one of the highest per capita incomes in the world, there is severe income inequality.<mask> is classified as an alpha+ world city, indicating its influence throughout the world. <mask> is one of the most significant global financial centres, holding the highest Financial Development Index score and consistently ranking as the most competitive and freest economic area in the world in 2017. The city has the largest number of skyscrapers in the world, most surrounding Victoria Harbour. <mask> consistently ranks high on the Human Development Index, and has one of the highest life expectancies in the world. Over 90 percent of its population uses public transportation. However, air pollution from neighbouring industrial areas of mainland <mask> has caused a high level of atmospheric particulates in the region.

<mask> (/ˌɡwɑːdəˈluːp/ [ɡwad(ə)lup]; <mask>an Creole French: Gwadloup [ɡwadlup]) is an overseas department and region of <mask> in the Caribbean. <mask>, officially the Swiss Confederation, is a sovereign state situated in the confluence of western, central, and southern Europe. It is a federal republic composed of 26 cantons, with federal authorities seated in Bern. <mask> is a landlocked country bordered by <mask> to the south, <mask> to the west, <mask> to the north, and <mask> and <mask> to the east. It is geographically divided between the Alps, the Swiss Plateau and the Jura, spanning a total area of 41,285 km2 (15,940 sq mi), and land area of 39,997 km2 (15,443 sq mi). While the Alps occupy the greater part of the territory, the Swiss population of approximately 8.5 million is concentrated mostly on the plateau, where the largest cities are located, among them the two global cities and economic centres of Zürich and Geneva.The establishment of the Old Swiss Confederacy dates to the late medieval period, resulting from a series of military successes against <mask> and Burgundy. Swiss independence from the Holy R<mask> Empire was formally recognized in the Peace of Westphalia in 1648. Since the Reformation of the 16th century, <mask> has maintained a strong policy of armed neutrality; it has not fought an international war since 1815 and did not join the United Nations until 2002. Nevertheless, it pursues an active foreign policy and is frequently involved in peace-building processes around the world.  <mask> is the birthplace of the Red Cross, one of the world's oldest and best known humanitarian organisations, and is home to numerous international organisations, including the second largest UN office. It is a founding member of the European Free Trade Association, but notably not part of the European Union, the European Economic Area or the Eurozone. However, it participates in the Schengen Area and the European Single Market through bilateral treaties.<mask> occupies the crossroads of Germanic and R<mask>ce Europe, as reflected in its four main linguistic and cultural regions: German, French, Italian and R<mask>sh. Although the majority of the population are German-speaking, Swiss national identity is rooted in a common historical background, shared values such as federalism and direct democracy, and Alpine symbolism. Due to its linguistic diversity, <mask> is known by a variety of native names: Schweiz [ˈʃvaɪts] (German); Suisse [sɥis(ə)] (French); Svizzera [ˈzvittsera] (Italian); and Svizra [ˈʒviːtsrɐ, ˈʒviːtsʁɐ] (R<mask>sh). On coins and stamps, the Latin name, Confoederatio Helvetica – frequently shortened to "Helvetia" – is used instead of the four national languages.<mask> is one of the most developed countries in the world, with the highest nominal wealth per adult and the eighth-highest per capita gross domestic product. It ranks at or near the top in several international metrics, including economic competitiveness and human development. Zürich, Geneva and Basel have been ranked among the top ten cities in the world in terms of quality of life, with Zürich ranked second globally.

<mask> ( (listen); <mask>ish: Lëtzebuerg [ˈlətsəbuə̯ɕ] (listen); French: <mask>; German: Luxemburg), officially the Grand Duchy of <mask>, is a small landlocked country in western Europe. It is bordered by <mask> to the west and north, <mask> to the east, and <mask> to the south. Its capital, <mask> City, is one of the four official capitals of the European Union (together with Brussels, Frankfurt, and Strasbourg) and the seat of the European Court of Justice, the highest judicial authority in the EU. Its culture, people, and languages are highly intertwined with its neighbours, making it essentially a mixture of French and German cultures, as evident by the nation's three official languages: French, German, and the national language of <mask>ish. The repeated invasions by <mask>, especially in World War II, resulted in the country's strong will for mediation between <mask> and <mask> and, among other things, led to the foundation of the European Union.With an area of 2,586 square kilometres (998 sq mi), it is one of the smallest sovereign states in Europe. In 2018, <mask> had a population of 602,005, which makes it one of the least-populous countries in Europe, but by far the one with the highest population growth rate. As a representative democracy with a constitutional monarch, it is headed by Grand Duke Henri and is the world's only remaining sovereign grand duchy. <mask> is a developed country, with an advanced economy and one of the world's highest GDP (PPP) per capita. The City of <mask> with its old quarters and fortifications was declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1994 due to the exceptional preservation of the vast fortifications and the old city.The history of <mask> is considered to begin in 963, when count Siegfried acquired a rocky promontory and its R<mask>-era fortifications known as Lucilinburhuc, ′little castle′, and the surrounding area from the Imperial Abbey of St. Maximin in nearby Trier. Siegfried's descendants increased their territory through marriage, war and vassal relations. At the end of the 13th century, the counts of <mask> reigned over a considerable territory.In 1308, Henry VII, Count of <mask> became King of the Germans and later Holy R<mask> Emperor. The House of <mask> produced four emperors during the High Middle Ages. In 1354, Charles IV elevated the county to the Duchy of <mask>. The duchy eventually became part of the Burgundian Circle and then one of the Seventeen Provinces of the Habsburg <mask>.Over the centuries, the City and Fortress of <mask>, of great strategic importance situated between the Kingdom of <mask> and the Habsburg territories, was gradually built up to be one of the most reputed fortifications in Europe. After belonging to both the <mask> of Louis XIV and the <mask> of Maria Theresa, <mask> became part of the First French Republic and Empire under Napoleon.The present-day state of <mask> first emerged at the Congress of Vienna in 1815. The Grand Duchy, with its powerful fortress, became an independent state under the personal possession of William I of the <mask> with a P<mask>n garrison to guard the city against another invasion from <mask>. In 1839, following the turmoil of the Belgian Revolution, the purely French-speaking part of <mask> was ceded to <mask> and the <mask>ish-speaking part (except the Arelerland, the area around Arlon) became what is the present state of <mask>.<mask> is a founding member of the European Union, OECD, United Nations, NATO, and Benelux. The city of <mask>, which is the country's capital and largest city, is the seat of several institutions and agencies of the EU. <mask> served on the United Nations Security Council for the years 2013 and 2014, which was a first in the country's history. As of 2018, <mask>ish citizens had visa-free or visa-on-arrival access to 186 countries and territories, ranking the <mask>ish passport 5th in the world, tied with <mask>, the <mask>, <mask>, <mask>, the <mask> and the <mask>.

<mask> (Portuguese: [puɾtuˈɣal]), officially the Portuguese Republic (Portuguese: República Portuguesa [ʁɛˈpuβlikɐ puɾtuˈɣezɐ]), is a country located mostly on the Iberian Peninsula in southwestern Europe. It is the westernmost sovereign state of mainland Europe, being bordered to the west and south by the Atlantic Ocean and to the north and east by <mask>. Its territory also includes the Atlantic archipelagos of the Azores and Madeira, both autonomous regions with their own regional governments.<mask> is the oldest nation state on the Iberian Peninsula and one of the oldest in Europe, its territory having been continuously settled, invaded and fought over since prehistoric times. The pre-Celtic people, Celts, Carthaginians and R<mask>s were followed by the invasions of the Visigoths and Suebi Germanic peoples. <mask> as a country was established during the Christian Reconquista against the Moors who had invaded the Iberian Peninsula in 711 AD. Founded in 868, the County of <mask> gained prominence after the Battle of São Mamede in 1128. The Kingdom of <mask> was later proclaimed following the Battle of Ourique in 1139, and independence from León was recognised by the Treaty of Zamora in 1143.In the 15th and 16th centuries, <mask> established the first global empire, becoming one of the world's major economic, political and military powers. During this period, today referred to as the Age of Discovery, Portuguese explorers pioneered maritime exploration, notably under royal patronage of Prince Henry the Navigator and King John II, with such notable voyages as Bartolomeu Dias' sailing beyond the Cape of Good Hope (1488), Vasco da Gama's discovery of the sea route to <mask> (1497–98) and the European discovery of <mask> (1500). During this time <mask> monopolized the spice trade, divided the world into hemispheres of dominion with Castille, and the empire expanded with military campaigns in Asia. However, events such as the 1755 Lisbon earthquake, the country's occupation during the Napoleonic Wars, the independence of <mask> (1822), and a late industrialization compared to other European powers, erased to a great extent <mask>'s prior opulence.After the 1910 revolution deposed the monarchy, the democratic but unstable Portuguese First Republic was established, later being superseded by the Estado Novo right-wing authoritarian regime. Democracy was restored after the Carnation Revolution in 1974, ending the Portuguese Colonial War. Shortly after, independence was granted to almost all its overseas territories. The handover of <mask> to <mask> in 1999 marked the end of what can be considered the longest-lived colonial empire.<mask> has left a profound cultural and architectural influence across the globe, a legacy of around 250 million Portuguese speakers, and many Portuguese-based creoles. It is a developed country with a high-income advanced economy and high living standards. Additionally, it is highly placed in rankings of moral freedom (2nd), peacefulness (3rd), democracy (8th), press freedom (12th), stability (15th), social progress (24th), prosperity (24th), and LGBT rights (7th in Europe). A member of the United Nations and the European Union, <mask> was also one of the founding members of NATO, the eurozone, the OECD, and the Community of Portuguese Language Countries.

<mask> ( (listen) kə-LUM-bee-ə,  -⁠LOM-; Spanish: [koˈlombja] (listen)), officially the Republic of <mask> (Spanish: República de <mask> ), is a sovereign state largely situated in the northwest of South America, with land, and territories in North America. <mask> shares a border to the west with <mask>, to the east with <mask> and <mask>,  and to the south with <mask> and <mask>. It shares its maritime limits with <mask>, <mask>, <mask>, <mask>, <mask>, and the <mask>. <mask> is a unitary, constitutional republic comprising thirty-two departments, with the capital in Bogotá.<mask> has been inhabited by various American <mask>n peoples since at least 12,000 BCE, including the Muisca, Quimbaya, and the Tairona, along with the Inca Empire that expanded to the southwest of the country. Spaniards arrived in 1499 and by the mid-16th century annexed part of the region, establishing the New Kingdom of Granada, with Santafé de Bogotá as its capital. The new nation experimented with federalism as the Granadine Confederation (1858), and then the <mask> of <mask> (1863), before the Republic of <mask> was finally declared in 1886. <mask> seceded in 1903, leading to <mask>'s present borders. Beginning in the 1960s, the country suffered from an asymmetric low-intensity armed conflict and political violence, both of which escalated in the 1990s. Since 2005, there has been significant improvement in security, stability, and rule of law.<mask> is the most ethnically and linguistically diverse country per capita, with its rich cultural heritage reflecting influences by various Amer<mask>n civilizations, European settlement, forced African labor, and immigration from Europe and the greater Middle East. Urban centres are concentrated in the Andean highlands and the Caribbean coast.<mask> is the most densely biodiverse country per square kilometer, and is part of the world's 17 megadiverse countries; its territory encompasses Amazon rainforest, highlands,  grasslands,  deserts, islands  and coastlines along both the Caribbean and Pacific.<mask> is a transcontinental country and a regional power in the Americas. It is part of the CIVETS group of leading emerging markets and a member of the UN, the WTO,  the OAS, the Pacific Alliance, and other international organizations. <mask>'s diversified economy is the third largest in South America, with macroeconomic stability and favorable long-term growth prospects.

<mask> (,  (listen); Maltese: [ˈmɐltɐ]), officially known as the Republic of <mask> (Maltese: Repubblika ta' <mask>), is a Southern European island country consisting of an archipelago in the Mediterranean Sea. It lies 80 km (50 mi) south of <mask>, 284 km (176 mi) east of <mask>, and 333 km (207 mi) north of <mask>. With a population of about 475,000 over an area of 316 km2 (122 sq mi), <mask> is the world's tenth smallest and fifth most densely populated country. Its capital is Valletta, which is the smallest national capital in the European Union by area at 0.8 km². The official languages are Maltese and English, with Maltese officially recognised as the national language and the only Semitic language in the European Union.<mask> has been inhabited since approximately 5900 BC. Its location in the centre of the Mediterranean has historically given it great strategic importance as a naval base, with a succession of powers having contested and ruled the islands, including the Phoenicians and Carthaginians, R<mask>s, Greeks, Arabs, Normans, Aragonese, Knights of St. John, French, and British. Most of these foreign influences have left some sort of mark on the country's ancient culture.<mask> became a British colony in 1815, serving as a way station for ships and the headquarters for the British Mediterranean Fleet. It played an important role in the Allied war effort during the Second World War, and was subsequently awarded the George Cross for its bravery in the face of an Axis siege, The British Parliament passed the <mask> Independence Act in 1964, giving <mask> independence from the <mask> as the State of <mask>, with Queen Elizabeth II as its head of state and queen. The country became a republic in 1974. It has been a member state of the Commonwealth of Nations and the United Nations since independence, and joined the European Union in 2004; it became part of the eurozone monetary union in 2008.<mask> has a long Christian legacy and its Archdiocese is claimed to be an apostolic see because Paul the Apostle was shipwrecked on "Melita", according to Acts of the Apostles, which is now widely taken to be <mask>. While Catholicism is the official religion in <mask>, Article 40 of the Constitution states that "all persons in <mask> shall have full freedom of conscience and enjoy the free exercise of their respective mode of religious worship."<mask> is a popular tourist destination with its warm climate, numerous recreational areas, and architectural and historical monuments, including three UNESCO World Heritage Sites: Hypogeum of Ħal-Saflieni, Valletta, and seven megalithic temples which are some of the oldest free-standing structures in the world.

<mask> (; previously known as the Union Islands, and officially as <mask> Islands until 1976; lit. "north-northeast") is a dependent territory of <mask> in the southern Pacific Ocean. It consists of three tropical coral atolls (Atafu, Nukunonu and Fakaofo), with a combined land area of 10 km2 (4 sq mi). The capital rotates yearly between the three atolls. <mask> lies north of the <mask>n Islands, east of <mask>, south of the Phoenix Islands, southwest of the more distant Line Islands, and northwest of the <mask>. Swains Island is geographically part of <mask>, but is subject to an ongoing territorial dispute and is currently administered by the <mask> as part of American <mask>.<mask> has a population of approximately 1,500 people, the fourth-smallest population of any sovereign state or dependency. As of the 2016 census, around 45% of residents were born overseas, mostly in <mask> and <mask>. The nation has a life expectancy of 69, comparable with other Oceanian island nations. Approximately 94% of the population speak <mask>an as a first language. <mask> has the smallest economy in the world, although it is a leader in renewable energy, being the first 100% solar powered nation in the world.<mask> is officially referred to as a nation by both the <mask> government and the <mask>an government. It is a free and democratic nation with elections every three years. However, in 2007 the United Nations General Assembly included <mask> on its list of non-self-governing territories. Its inclusion on the list is controversial, as <mask>ans have twice voted against further self-determination and the islands' small population reduces the viability of self-government. The basis of <mask>'s legislative, administrative and judicial systems is the <mask> Islands Act 1948, which has been amended on a number of occasions. Since 1993, the territory has annually elected its own head of government, the Ulu-o-<mask>. Previously the Administrator of <mask> was the highest official in the government and the territory was administered directly by a <mask> government department.

<mask> ( (listen); Spanish: [ˈkosta ˈrika]; literally "Rich Coast"), officially the Republic of <mask> (Spanish: República de <mask>), is a sovereign state in Central America, bordered by <mask> to the north, the Caribbean Sea to the northeast, <mask> to the southeast, the Pacific Ocean to the southwest, and <mask> to the south of Cocos Island. It has a population of around 5 million in a land area of 51,060 square kilometers (19,714 square miles). An estimated 333,980 people live in the capital and largest city, San José with around 2 million people in the surrounding metropolitan area.<mask> is a unitary presidential constitutional republic. It is known for its long-standing and stable democracy, and for its highly educated workforce, most of whom speak English. The country spends roughly 6.9% of its budget (2016) on education, compared to a global average of 4.4%. Its economy, once heavily dependent on agriculture, has diversified to include sectors such as finance, corporate services for foreign companies, pharmaceuticals, and ecotourism. Many foreign manufacturing and services companies operate in <mask>'s Free Trade Zones (FTZ) where they benefit from investment and tax incentives.<mask> was facing a market liquidity crisis in 2017 due to a growing debt and budget deficit. By August 2017, the Treasury was having difficulty paying its obligations. Other challenges facing the country in its attempts to improve the economy by increasing foreign investment include a poor infrastructure and a need to improve public sector efficiency.<mask> was sparsely inhabited by indigenous peoples before coming under Spanish rule in the 16th century. It remained a peripheral colony of the empire until independence as part of the First Mexican Empire, followed by membership in the United Provinces of Central America, from which it formally declared independence in 1847. Since then, <mask> has remained among the most stable, prosperous, and progressive nations in Latin America. Following the brief <mask>n Civil War, it permanently abolished its army in 1949, becoming one of only a few sovereign nations without a standing army.The country has consistently performed favorably in the Human Development Index (HDI), placing 69th in the world as of 2015, among the highest of any Latin American nation. It has also been cited by the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) as having attained much higher human development than other countries at the same income levels, with a better record on human development and inequality than the median of the region.<mask> also has progressive environmental policies. It is the only country to meet all five UNDP criteria established to measure environmental sustainability. It was ranked 42nd in the world, and third in the Americas, in the 2016 Environmental Performance Index, and was twice ranked the best performing country in the New Economics Foundation's (NEF) Happy Planet Index, which measures environmental sustainability, and was identified by the NEF as the greenest country in the world in 2009. <mask> plans to become a carbon-neutral country by 2021. By  2016, 98.1% of its electricity was generated from green sources particularly hydro, solar, geothermal and biomass.

<mask> ( (listen) al-JEER-ee-ə; Arabic: الجزائر‎, r<mask>ized: al-Jazāʾir, <mask>n Arabic: الدزاير‎, r<mask>ized: al-dzāyīr; French: Algérie), officially the People's Democratic Republic of <mask> (Arabic: الجمهورية الجزائرية الديمقراطية الشعبية‎, r<mask>ized: al-Jumhūriyya al-Jazāʾiriyya ad-Dīmuqrāṭiyya aš-Šaʿbiyya, French: République Algérienne Démocratique et Populaire), is a country in the Maghreb region of North Africa. The capital and most populous city is Algiers, located in the far north of the country on the Mediterranean coast. With an area of 2,381,741 square kilometres (919,595 sq mi), <mask> is the tenth-largest country in the world, the  world's largest Arab country, and the largest in Africa. <mask> is bordered to the northeast by <mask>, to the east by <mask>, to the west by <mask>, to the southwest by the <mask>n territory, <mask>, and <mask>, to the southeast by <mask>, and to the north by the Mediterranean Sea. The country is a semi-presidential republic consisting of 48 provinces and 1,541 communes (counties). It has the highest human development index of all non-island African countries.Ancient <mask> has known many empires and dynasties, including ancient Numidians, Phoenicians, Carthaginians, R<mask>s, Vandals, Byzantines, Umayyads, Abbasids, Idrisid, Aghlabid, Rustamid, Fatimids, Zirid, Hammadids, Almoravids, Almohads, Spaniards, Ott<mask>s and the French colonial empire. Berbers are the indigenous inhabitants of <mask>.<mask> is a regional and middle power. It supplies large amounts of natural gas to Europe, and energy exports are the backbone of the economy. According to OPEC <mask> has the 16th largest oil reserves in the world and the second largest in Africa, while it has the 9th largest reserves of natural gas. Sonatrach, the national oil company, is the largest company in Africa. <mask> has one of the largest militaries in Africa and the largest defence budget on the continent; most of <mask>'s weapons are imported from <mask>, with whom they are a close ally. <mask> is a member of the African Union, the Arab League, OPEC, the United Nations and is a founding member of the Arab Maghreb Union.On 2 April 2019, president Abdelaziz Bouteflika resigned after nearly 20 years in power, following pressure from mass protests against a fifth term.

<mask>, officially the Republic of <mask> (RSA), is the southernmost country in Africa. It is bounded to the south by 2,798 kilometres (1,739 mi) of coastline of Southern Africa stretching along the South Atlantic and <mask>n Oceans; to the north by the neighbouring countries of <mask>, <mask>, and <mask>; and to the east and northeast by <mask> and Eswatini (<mask>); and it surrounds the enclaved country of <mask>. <mask> is the largest country in Southern Africa and the 25th-largest country in the world by land area and, with over 57 million people, is the world's 24th-most populous nation. It is the southernmost country on the mainland of the Old World or the Eastern Hemisphere. About 80 percent of <mask>ns are of Bantu ancestry, divided among a variety of ethnic groups speaking different African languages, nine of which have official status. The remaining population consists of Africa's largest communities of European, Asian (<mask>n), and multiracial (Coloured) ancestry.<mask> is a multiethnic society encompassing a wide variety of cultures, languages, and religions. Its pluralistic makeup is reflected in the constitution's recognition of 11 official languages, which is the fourth-highest number in the world. Two of these languages are of European origin: Afrikaans developed from Dutch and serves as the first language of most coloured and white <mask>ns; English reflects the legacy of British colonialism, and is commonly used in public and commercial life, though it is fourth-ranked as a spoken first language. The country is one of the few in Africa never to have had a coup d'état, and regular elections have been held for almost a century. However, the vast majority of black <mask>ns were not enfranchised until 1994. During the 20th century, the black majority sought to claim more rights from the dominant white minority, with this struggle playing a large role in the country's recent history and politics. The National Party imposed apartheid in 1948, institutionalising previous racial segregation. After a long and sometimes violent struggle by the African National Congress (ANC) and other anti-apartheid activists both inside and outside the country, the repeal of discriminatory laws began in the mid-1980s.Since 1994, all ethnic and linguistic groups have held political representation in the country's liberal democracy, which comprises a parliamentary republic and nine provinces. <mask> is often referred to as the "rainbow nation" to describe the country's multicultural diversity, especially in the wake of apartheid. The World Bank classifies <mask> as an upper-middle-income economy, and a newly industrialised country. Its economy is the second-largest in Africa, and the 33rd-largest in the world. In terms of purchasing power parity, <mask> has the seventh-highest per capita income in Africa. However, poverty and inequality remain widespread, with about a quarter of the population unemployed and living on less than US$1.25 a day. Nevertheless, <mask> has been identified as a middle power in international affairs, and maintains significant regional influence.

The <mask> (; Pitkern: Pitkern Ailen), officially Pitcairn, Henderson, Ducie and Oeno Islands, are a group of four volcanic islands in the southern Pacific Ocean that form the sole British Overseas Territory in the Pacific Ocean. The four islands—Pitcairn proper, Henderson, Ducie and Oeno—are scattered across several hundred miles of ocean and have a combined land area of about 18 square miles (47 km2). Henderson Island accounts for 86% of the land area, but only Pitcairn Island is inhabited. The nearest places are Mangareva (of <mask>) to the west and Easter Island to the east.Pitcairn is the least populous national jurisdiction in the world. The Pitcairn Islanders are a biracial ethnic group descended mostly from nine Bounty mutineers and the handful of Tahitians who accompanied them, an event that has been retold in many books and films. This history is still apparent in the surnames of many of the islanders. Today there are approximately 50 permanent inhabitants, originating from four main families.

<mask> ( (listen); (Arabic: موريتانيا‎, Mūrītānyā, French: Mauritanie), officially the Islamic Republic of <mask>, is a country in Northwest Africa. It is the eleventh largest sovereign state in Africa and is bordered by the Atlantic Ocean to the west, <mask> to the north and northwest, <mask> to the northeast, <mask> to the east and southeast, and <mask> to the southwest.The country derives its name from the ancient Berber kingdom of Mauretania, which existed from the 3rd century BCE into the 7th century CE in the far north of modern-day <mask> and <mask>. The capital and largest city is Nouakchott, located on the Atlantic coast, which is home to around one-third of the country's 4.3 million people. The government was overthrown on 6 August 2008, in a military coup d'état led by General Mohamed Ould Abdel Aziz. On 16 April 2009, Aziz resigned from the military to run for president in the 19 July elections, which he won.

<mask> (<mask>i: नेपाल, ISO:Nēpāl), officially Federal Democratic Republic of <mask>, is a landlocked country in South Asia. It is located mainly in the Himalayas, but also includes parts of the Indo-Gangetic Plain. With an estimated population of 26.4 million, it is 48th largest country by population and 93rd largest country by area. It borders <mask> in the north and <mask> in the south, east and west while <mask> is located within only 27 km (17 mi) of its southeastern tip and <mask> is separated from it by the <mask>n state of Sikkim. <mask> has a diverse geography, including fertile plains, subalpine forested hills, and eight of the world's ten tallest mountains, including Mount Everest, the highest point on Earth. Kathmandu is the capital and the largest city. <mask> is a multiethnic country with <mask>i as the official language.The name "<mask>" is first recorded in texts from the Vedic period of the <mask>n subcontinent, the era in ancient <mask> when Hinduism was founded, the predominant religion of the country. In the middle of the first millennium BCE, Gautama Buddha, the founder of Buddhism, was born in Lumbini in southern <mask>. Parts of northern <mask> were intertwined with the culture of Tibet. The centrally located Kathmandu Valley is intertwined with the culture of Indo-Aryans, and was the seat of the prosperous Newar confederacy known as <mask> Mandala. The Himalayan branch of the ancient Silk Road was dominated by the valley's traders. The cosmopolitan region developed distinct traditional art and architecture. By the 18th century, the Gorkha Kingdom achieved the unification of <mask>. The Shah dynasty established the Kingdom of <mask> and later formed an alliance with the British Empire, under its Rajput Rana dynasty of premiers. The country was never colonized but served as a buffer state between Imperial <mask> and British <mask>. Parliamentary democracy was introduced in 1951, but was twice suspended by <mask>ese monarchs, in 1960 and 2005. The <mask>ese Civil War in the 1990s and early 2000s resulted in the proclamation of a secular republic in 2008, ending the world's last Hindu monarchy.The Constitution of <mask>, adopted in 2015, affirms <mask> as a secular federal parliamentary republic divided into seven provinces. <mask> was admitted to the United Nations in 1955, and friendship treaties were signed with <mask> in 1950 and the People's Republic of <mask> in 1960. <mask> hosts the permanent secretariat of the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC), of which it is a founding member. <mask> is also a member of the Non Aligned Movement and the Bay of Bengal Initiative. The military of <mask> is the fifth largest in South Asia; it is notable for its Gurkha history, particularly during the world wars, and has been a significant contributor to United Nations peacekeeping operations.

<mask> (Chinese: 中国; pinyin: Zhōngguó; lit. "Middle Kingdom"), officially the People's Republic of <mask> (PRC), is a country in East Asia and the world's most populous country, with a population of around 1.404 billion. Covering approximately 9,600,000 square kilometers (3,700,000 sq mi), it is the fourth largest country by total area. Governed by the Communist Party of <mask>, the state exercises jurisdiction over 22 provinces, five autonomous regions, four direct-controlled municipalities (Beijing, Tianjin, Shanghai, and Chongqing), and the special administrative regions of <mask> and <mask>.<mask> emerged as one of the world's earliest civilizations, in the fertile basin of the Yellow River in the North <mask> Plain. For millennia, <mask>'s political system was based on hereditary monarchies, or dynasties, beginning with the semi-legendary Xia dynasty in 21st century BCE. Since then, <mask> has expanded, fractured, and re-unified numerous times. In the 3rd century BCE, the Qin reunited core <mask> and established the first Chinese empire. The succeeding Han dynasty, which ruled from 206 BC until 220 AD, saw some of the most advanced technology at that time, including papermaking and the compass, along with agricultural and medical improvements. The invention of gunpowder and movable type in the Tang dynasty (618–907) and Northern Song (960–1127) completed the Four Great Inventions. Tang culture spread widely in Asia, as the new Silk Route brought traders to as far as Mesopotamia and the Horn of Africa. Dynastic rule ended in 1912 with the Xinhai Revolution, when the republic replaced the Qing dynasty. <mask> as a whole was ravaged by <mask> during World War II, and the subsequent Chinese Civil War resulted in a division of territory in 1949, when the Communist Party of <mask> established the People's Republic of <mask>, a unitary one-party sovereign state on the majority of <mask>, while the Kuomintang-led nationalist government retreated to the island of <mask>. The political status of <mask> remains disputed.Since the introduction of economic reforms in 1978, <mask>'s economy has been one of the world's fastest-growing with annual growth rates consistently above 6 percent. According to the World Bank, <mask>'s GDP grew from $150 billion in 1978 to $12.24 trillion by 2017. According to official data, <mask>'s GDP in 2018 was 90 trillion Yuan ($13.28 trillion). Since 2010, <mask> has been the world's second-largest economy by nominal GDP and since 2014, the largest economy in the world by purchasing power parity (PPP). <mask> is also the world's largest exporter and second-largest importer of goods. <mask> is a recognized nuclear weapons state and has the world's largest standing army and second-largest defense budget. The PRC is a permanent member of the United Nations Security Council as it replaced the ROC in 1971, as well as an active global partner of ASEAN Plus mechanism. <mask> is also a leading member of numerous formal and informal multilateral organizations, including the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO), WTO, APEC, BRICS, the BCIM, and the G20. <mask> has been characterized as a potential superpower, mainly because of its massive population, economy, and military.

<mask> ( (listen), ), officially the Republic of <mask>, is the southernmost island country in the Caribbean. Unlike most of the English-speaking Caribbean, the economy is primarily industrial with an emphasis on petroleum and petrochemicals; much of the nation's wealth is derived from its large reserves of oil and natural gas.<mask> is known for its Carnival and Diwali celebrations and as the birthplace of steelpan, the limbo, and music styles such as calypso, soca, parang and chutney.

<mask> ( (listen) grin-AY-də) is a sovereign state in the West Indies in the Caribbean Sea at the southern end of the Grenadines island chain. <mask> consists of the island of <mask> itself plus six smaller islands which lie to the north of the main island. It is located northwest of <mask>, northeast of <mask> and southwest of <mask>. Its size is 348.5 square kilometres (134.6 sq mi), and it had an estimated population of 112,200 in July 2018. Its capital is St. George's. <mask> is also known as the "Island of Spice" due to its production of nutmeg and mace crops, of which it is one of the world's largest exporters. The national bird of <mask> is the critically endangered <mask> dove.Before the arrival of Europeans in the Americas, <mask> was inhabited by the indigenous Arawaks and later by the Island Caribs.. Christopher Columbus sighted <mask> in 1498 during his third voyage to the Americas.. Although it was deemed the property of the King of <mask>, there are no records to suggest the Spanish ever landed or settled on the island. Following several unsuccessful attempts by Europeans to colonise the island due to resistance from the Island Caribs, French settlement and colonisation began in 1650 and continued for the next century. On 10 February 1763, <mask> was ceded to the British under the Treaty of Paris. British rule continued until 1974 (except for a period of French rule between 1779 and 1783). From 1958 to 1962 <mask> was part of the Federation of the West Indies, a short-lived federation of British West <mask>n colonies. On 3 March 1967, <mask> was granted full autonomy over its internal affairs as an Associated State.Independence was granted on 7 February 1974, without breaking formal ties with the Commonwealth, under the leadership of Eric Gairy, who became the first Prime Minister of <mask>, with Queen Elizabeth as Head of State. In March 1979, the Marxist–Leninist New Jewel Movement overthrew Gairy's government in a popular bloodless coup d'état and established the People's Revolutionary Government (PRG), headed by Maurice Bishop as Prime Minister. Bishop was later executed by military hardliners, prompting a US led invasion in October 1983. Since then democratic governance has been restored and the island has remained politically stable.

<mask>, officially the State of <mask>, is a country in West Asia. <mask> ( (listen); Arabic: الكويت‎ al-<mask>, Gulf Arabic pronunciation: [ɪl‿ɪkweːt] or [lɪkweːt]), officially the State of <mask> (Arabic: دولة الكويت‎ Dawlat al-<mask>), is a country in Western Asia.
